modules.description: This module implements a network backend for managing virtual network interfaces with support for asynchronous packet transmission and reception. It provides operations to register and unregister network listeners, send packets with a specified size and buffer, and set callback functions for incoming data. Use cases include handling virtual machine networking, packet filtering, and network device emulation.

This module implements a virtual network interface for bridging packets in a software-defined network. It provides functions to send and receive packets via `write` and `listen`, manage MAC and MTU settings, and track interface statistics with `get_stats_counters` and `reset_stats_counters`. It is used to simulate or connect to a network backend `B` for virtualized networking, such as in unikernel environments.

This module implements a network backend for managing virtual network interfaces, supporting asynchronous packet transmission and reception. It provides functions to register and unregister network listeners, send packets with specified size and buffer, and set callbacks for handling incoming data. Use cases include virtual machine networking, packet filtering, and network device emulation.

This module implements a virtual network interface for bridging packets in software-defined networks, providing operations to send and receive packets, configure MAC and MTU settings, and track or reset interface statistics. It works with a specified network backend to enable virtualized networking scenarios, such as those found in unikernel environments.
